description: This course compares Christian and Islamic conceptions of the relationship between God and humanity, as foundations for thinking about moral excellence and obligation. It also considers and compares how theological commitments and methods in each religious tradition affect approaches to particular ethical issues such as sexuality, war and politics. Students work with scripture, film, polemical literature, judicial texts and theological texts. Prerequisites: BTS-B and BTS-T.
name: Christ/Islamic Ethics
title: Christian and Islamic Ethics: Conflicts and Cross-Pollination
